name: e2e
description: Builds and serves an Angular app, then runs end-to-end tests using Protractor.
longDescription:
Must be executed from within a workspace directory.
When a project name is not supplied, it will execute for all projects.

options.name: project
options.description: The name of the project to build. Can be an app or a library.

options.name: configuration
options.description:
A named build target, as specified in the "configurations" section of angular.json.
Each named target is accompanied by a configuration of option defaults for that target.

options.name: prod
options.description:
When true, sets the build configuration to the production target.
All builds make use of bundling and limited tree-shaking. A production build also runs limited dead code elimination.

options.name: help
options.description: Shows a help message for this command in the console.

options.name: protractorConfig
options.description: The name of the Protractor configuration file.

options.name: devServerTarget
options.description: Dev server target to run tests against.

options.name: specs
options.description: Override specs in the protractor config.

options.name: suite
options.description: Override suite in the protractor config.

options.name: elementExplorer
options.description: Start Protractor's Element Explorer for debugging.

options.name: port
options.description: The port to use to serve the application.

options.name: baseUrl
options.description: Base URL for protractor to connect to.
